security: Revealing the identities and activities of sources and contacts such as [GEORGE HOPPING], [MRS GEDDES] and ANTONIO CUESTA, as well as operational details about AMDENIM-1 and AMDENIM-4, could jeopardize their safety and compromise ongoing intelligence operations. The reference to 'BARK interest' and the attempt to purchase a high-speed boat suggests covert activities that, if exposed, could damage relationships. Citing: "ONE OF [MRS GEDDES] ASSOCIATES PER REF B, ONE ANTONIO CUESTA, FORMER CREWMEMBER TEJANA III FRIEND OF AMDENIM-1... A-4 NOT AWARE BARK INTEREST [MRS GEDDES]."
summary: A classified message from the JMBAR station reports on Antonio Cuesta, an associate of [MRS GEDDES] and former crewmember of the Tejana III, who is making inquiries about a boat and may return to PBRUMEN soon; the message also notes that AMDENIM-4 is unaware of BARK's interest in [MRS GEDDES].
summary_one_paragraph: On November 24, 1961, JMBAR station sent a SECRET classified message to the Director regarding Antonio Cuesta, an associate of [MRS GEDDES] and former crewmember of the Tejana III, who is a friend of AMDENIM-1. Cuesta, according to a reliable source [GEORGE HOPPING], is making inquiries about a boat. AMDENIM-4 reports that Cuesta may return to PBRUMEN soon, but A-4 is not aware of BARK's interest in [MRS GEDDES]. The message references previous communications and requests further details on AMDENIM-2's contact with a boat dealer on behalf of two Cubans attempting to purchase a high-speed boat.
title: Report on Antonio Cuesta and Boat Inquiries
